text: Born to Run is the third studio album by Bruce Springsteen and released on August 25, 1975 through Columbia Records. ==Rankings== It went to number 3 in the United States, number 7 in Australia, the Netherlands and Sweden, number 20 in Ireland, number 26 in Norway, number 28 in New Zealand, number 31 in Ireland and number 36 in the United Kingdom. In 2020, the album was ranked #18 in the Rolling Stone's 500 Greatest Albums of All Time. {{Album ratings | rev1 = Blender | rev1Score = Posted at | rev2 = Entertainment Weekly | rev2score = Aâˆ’ | rev3 = The Guardian | rev3score = | rev4 = Pitchfork | rev4Score = 10/10 | rev5 = Stylus Magazine | rev5score = A }} ==Track listing== ===Original release=== ===Cassette version=== The cassette version has the song order rearranged to save tape space, which was a common practice amongst the record companies. The track listing for the cassette is as follows: ===Unreleased outtakes=== There are currently seven known outtakes from the album: *"Linda Let Me Be The One" *"Lonely Night in the Park" *"A Love So Fine" *"A Night Like This" *"Janey Needs a Shooter" *"Lovers in The Cold" *"So Young and in Love" ==References== Category:1975 albums Category:Bruce Springsteen albums
title: Born to Run
